description: Compact domain bootstrap terms for AI assistants used with GENtle.

terms.definition: Carrier DNA backbone used to host an insert.
terms.prompt_hint: Ask for vector name, host context, and required cloning constraints.

terms.definition: Sequence fragment intended to be introduced into a vector.
terms.prompt_hint: Ask for exact sequence ID or coordinate range.

terms.definition: Coding sequence expected to preserve reading frame.
Annotated genomic unit that may include multiple transcripts.
terms.prompt_hint: If transcript ambiguity exists, ask user to disambiguate.
Confirm desired upstream/downstream orientation and strand context.

terms.definition: Recognition sequence for a restriction endonuclease.
terms.prompt_hint: Ask for required and forbidden enzyme sites.

terms.definition: Single-stranded end produced or designed for assembly.
terms.prompt_hint: Confirm compatible overhang directionality before ligation suggestions.

terms.definition: Joining DNA ends into one continuous molecule.
terms.prompt_hint: Use as conceptual step; keep recommendations in-silico unless requested.
Ask for overlap length and fragment order if assembly planning is needed.

terms.definition: Type IIS restriction-based modular assembly method.
terms.prompt_hint: Ask for enzyme choice and forbidden internal sites.

terms.definition: In-sequence positional reference used to define local intervals.
terms.prompt_hint: Use for between-anchor extraction and candidate generation on one sequence.

terms.definition: Provenance mapping of a sequence to assembly coordinates.
terms.prompt_hint: Required for genome track import and genome extension workflows.

terms.definition: Explicit set of windows/subsequences with per-candidate metrics.
terms.prompt_hint: Prefer set algebra and explicit filters instead of ad-hoc ranking prose.

terms.definition: Composite score from metrics with weights and optimization directions.
Set of non-dominated candidates across multiple objectives.
terms.prompt_hint: Use when objectives conflict and weighted tradeoff is uncertain.

terms.definition: Sequence similarity search to assess uniqueness/off-target risk.
terms.prompt_hint: Ask for target catalog (genome/helper), max hits, and task mode.

terms.definition: Interval-based external evidence projected onto anchored sequence.
terms.prompt_hint: Not all BED records are regulatory; keep neutral TRACK grouping.

terms.definition: Continuous signal track (coverage/enrichment) projected on sequence.
terms.prompt_hint: Use for quantitative context; convert to intervals only when needed.

terms.definition: Per-request mode for agent actions: chat-only, ask-before-run, auto.
terms.prompt_hint: Always require explicit user choice for risky operations.
